thread.title: Sports briefs: Hartem clicks at Williamsville
thread.title_full: Sports briefs: Hartem clicks at Williamsville

author: The Courier
title: Sports briefs: Hartem clicks at Williamsville
text: Posted Oct. 2, 2015 at 1:36 PM By The Courier Posted Oct. 2, 2015 at 1:36 PM WILLIAMSVILLE The Hartsburg-Emden volleyball team soundly defeated Williamsville 2-0 on Thursday: 25-20 and 25-17. The Lady Lynx had a balanced effort, led by senior setter Adre Vetter with 19 assists and five blocks. Kaylee Beekman recorded five kills, while Lexi Strange and Emme Olson had six and five service points, respectively. Olson also had seven digs. The Lady Stags are now 13-2 overall. The Hartem JV team also won 25-22 and 25-22 and improved to 9-1. Lady Toppers wallop Illini Bluffs The Mount Pulaski volleyball team dominated Illini Bluffs 2-0 at home Thursday: 25-15 and 25-8. Senior Maddy Davis led the way with 11 kills, five digs, two blocks and one ace. Abigail Fitzpatrick, Lilly Pickett and Skylar Hayes each had three kills. Hayes also had 11 digs. Alexandra Beckers provided 17 set assists. Volley for the Cure Oct. 15 The Mount Pulaski volleyball team will host Volley for the Cure Thursday, Oct. 15 4:30 to 6:30 p.m. in the high school cafeteria. It will include a pulled pork and pork chop sandwich meal, silent auction, balloon pop game, fishing games and a bake sale. The volleyball matches will start at 6 p.m. There will be a live auction after the games. T-shirts are on sale at the high school and grade school now, along with tickets from teachers and volleyball players. All proceeds will be donated to a local person affected by cancer. Lady Wolverines easily capture title The West Lincoln-Broadwell 8th grade girls basketball team clinched its third straight Carroll Catholic Tournament title 48-2 Thursday. Madelyn Koehler led the Lady Wolverines with 14 points, while Leah Schneider had 13. Makayla Anderson added seven points, followed by Asia Sales with six and Emily Paulus with four. Brooke Montcalm and Madison Orebaugh each had two points. They jumped to 5-1 with the championship. By The Courier
